reviews.review_msg: . Asked her a simple question instead she emails back with attitude and no help telling me to check the website because someone asked the question already. I have no problem doing so but when you don't get any notifications and have to read every stupid post written it becomes annoying.

currently in her crim 1100 online class and can say that her marking is awful. she'd give me 30% with a well written response to her discussion topic because I'd forget to reply a line to another student. Then her term project I had written an awesome violent crime paper and I swear she fixed 5 grammatical errors and just gave me 70%.. im an A+ stu

Shereen was awesome! Her tests were online so it wasn't the typical/formal test setting (which can stress some people out, like myself) Her lectures are great, she gives you enough time to write down the slides as there's quite a bit of theory info. Tests I would say are 70% in class notes and 30% textbook.
an ok prof.
Tough grader who expects verbatim textbook answers. Participation is mandatory, but lectures are brief and unhelpful. Unstuck ai was a lifesaver for studying - better than the textbook alone.

Very poor teaching style as well as an incredibly hard grader. Amy will only give you close to full credit on an exam question if it is word for word what is in the textbook plus more. Do not take her class unless you are willing to be marked extremely hard on topics that are not even covered in class

Very poor teaching experience, not clear instructions for test content. Also an insanely hard marker who will never give full credit and only give a 7/10 if 100% of the answer is listed. Constant participation is mandatory, just a horrible professor to have in an intro class.
Worse Professor ever. I don't recommend taking her class she will fail you if you missed one of her class.

Lectures are pointless and are only 20 mins so you really dont learn anything. Expects you to know the textbook by heart and cite it everytime for the participation homework. She doesnt allow you to think freely and give opinions on the subject and rather you cite the textbook. She doesnt give enough time for the written part of the quizzes. L prof

I would like to preface this with the fact that i took her intro class for a grade booster.

She is a wonderful teacher but the coursework has a lot of readings, and she grades pretty hard.

If you plan on taking her class as an "easy grade booster", be prepared to put in time and effort.

I wish I had read the other reviews posted but unfortunately I joined the class as a last minute GPA booster thing and now I'm most probably going to withdraw. In all my 3 years of studying, I have never seen a professor as bad and as hard of a marker as Amy. I only took this as an intro elective class and now I heavily regret it. don't take her.

I just finished a course with Amy Conroy and she did a very decent job teaching it.  The material was not difficult to understand and she has a lot of knowledge when it comes to the subject matter at hand. If you are in class and do the assigned readings you should be able to do well with her as a professor.

She is always available to answer questions and provide feedback, and she creates a welcoming and inclusive environment that fosters engagement and learning. Her knowledgeable material and talent for presenting complex concepts in an accessible way make her an exceptional teacher.
A fantastic prof, really cares about how you are doing and wants you to do well. Her assignments are straightforward and as long as you participate and hand everything in , it is easy to do well.

This professor was not understanding at all, I was not given credit for an assignment simply because one of the attachments would not open for her. Everything was completed and handed in on time but I was given a 0. Very hard exams, and when students ask questions in her class her way of responding to them is not encouraging nor pleasant.

Colleen is a great choice as a professor. She gives great and interesting lectures which keeps you engaged throughout the whole class. You definitely have to read the textbook and make sure you're taking notes always in order to do well. She cares about her students if you show you care about her class.

Collin has definantly been one of my favourite professors, if you try and read the lectures you will do good in the exams.. shes a very fair marker and if she sees you put in effort and know the material she will bump your grade up.

Aynsley was an amazing prof! She relies heavily on class participation and attendance  and marks you on it as well.  Her lectures are fast paced, but incredibly informative and well laid out. She was always on time and super organized which was definitely appreciated. I would absolutely take her again for crim!

Such a great professor. Even though the study material is hard and can be boring sometimes, she made the lecture and engaging. A very energetic professor who is available for questions anytime you want. Very easy marker, as long as you write something on the paper, she will give you some marks, so don't leave blanks even the short answer questions.

Lectures are interesting and participation matters. She gives you every opportunity to improve your grade and will give your credit if you do the homework.  Take notes on the videos. Exams are not hard if you pay attention to her lectures.
enjoyable lectures, funny and very likable. 3 hour lectures go by pretty fast. (definitely eye candy)

Josh is one of the best profs I've had at Kwantlen. He keeps the class engaged and genuinely cares about the subject matter. I would recommend taking a course with him as opposed to another prof, I will definitely retake another course with him!
